info.title: Real-time dispatch
info.description:
The real-time dispatch API provides a GET action and returns a set of three variables — dispatch prices, generation or dispatch megawatts, and megawatts of load. Note that dispatch prices are similar to but not identical to real-time prices â€“ dispatch prices are generated a few minutes apart from real-time prices.

In order to use the real-time dispatch API you must subscribe to the Wholesale market prices API product to receive your API key.

The real-time dispatch API will return the following fields:

  • PointOfConnectionCode
  • FiveMinuteIntervalDatetime
  • FiveMinuteIntervalNumber
  • RunDateTime
  • SPDLoadMegawatt
  • SPDGenerationMegawatt
  • DollarsPerMegawattHour

A policy has been applied to the wholesale price APIs restricting users to 60 calls per minute and a total of 60 MB of data per hour. The Authority may revise this policy if high rates of utilisation negatively impacts performance.

get.description:
The GET action returns the latest set of real-time dispatch variables as a JSON result set. Optionally the result set can be influenced by providing a range of OData filters on

  • PointOfConnectionCode
  • FiveMinuteIntervalDatetime
  • FiveMinuteIntervalNumber
  • DollarsPerMegawattHour

Some OData filter examples

  • For field PointOfConnectionCode, valid operators are: eq, and here are some examples:
    • $filter=PointOfConnectionCode eq 'AB1234'
  • For field FiveMinuteIntervalDatetime, valid operators are: eq, and here are some examples:
    • $filter=FiveMinuteIntervalDatetime eq datetime'2020-04-01T00:00'
  • For field FiveMinuteIntervalNumber, valid operators are: eq, le, ge, and here are some examples:
    • $filter=FiveMinuteIntervalNumber eq 15
    • $filter=FiveMinuteIntervalNumber ge 23
    • $filter=FiveMinuteIntervalNumber le 10
    • $filter=FiveMinuteIntervalNumber ge 1 and FiveMinuteIntervalNumber le 2
  • For field DollarsPerMegawattHour, valid operators are: eq, le, ge, and here are some examples:
    • $filter=DollarsPerMegawattHour eq 15.0M
    • $filter=DollarsPerMegawattHour ge 23.0M
    • $filter=DollarsPerMegawattHour le 10.0M
    • $filter=DollarsPerMegawattHour ge 199.4M and DollarsPerMegawattHour le 200.1M

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: ODATA to limit result set, eg ?$filter=DollarsPerMegawattHour eq 15.0M
